author: Jen Walton
text:
The dusty Lamar supercell from Sunday, shortly after the tornado warnings had expired. 💨
#cowx #girlswhochase https://t.co/L4kh1zvMS1

author: Jen Walton
text: This is an important conversation. Thanks to Sarah for speaking with me! https://t.co/jcCzUwlSKI

author: Jen Walton
text: Coloradan for life. https://t.co/HMjJ2ByOB8

author: Jen Walton
text:
So, wow. Some good reminders from today:
1. Always Lamar. 
2. Never doubt what CO can get done with absolute crap for moisture. 
3. It’s possible to be cored, then cored again. 
4. You don’t have to eat Casey’s or Allsup’s to be in a tornado warning. 😊 https://t.co/RrfbLEgVRn

author: Jen Walton
text: Area of rotation on tornado-warned storm over Lamar. @NWSPueblo #cowx https://t.co/01NS71GGiR

author: Jen Walton
text: Current view of “RFD cut” in area of rotation near tornado warned storm near Wiley. ⁦@NWSPueblo⁩ #cowx https://t.co/cpBBk08wjB

author: Jen Walton
text: Storm just north of Las Animas has a ways to go with the moisture but pretty healthy all things considered. ⁦@NWSPueblo⁩ #cowx https://t.co/YkTBsJ4mis

author: Jen Walton
text: Sometimes chasing brings you home. This Forest Service office is what first brought me to Colorado in 1999 & where I trained as a wildland firefighter. Was about to head east to get ahead of this little storm & had to stop & say hi. 💚🔥 https://t.co/mf513MSH1u

author: Jen Walton
text: NGL was a tad shocked at this storm that made it up right over me in La Junta. We’ll see if it can hang together in low moisture! Hard to see but pretty stout updraft on right side of the further base. ⁦@NWSPueblo⁩ #cowx https://t.co/Ear5bjrgul

author: Jen Walton
text:
Us: I mean a 30 degree dewpoint might be asking a bit much…
Colorado: Hold my beer. https://t.co/j3IY0HP19C

Colorado made me wait until almost May to see one of these but the moment has finally arrived. (for next Wed) #cowx https://t.co/RDoDxZVAN2

author: Jen Walton
text:
I'm just a girl
In this world
Asking to see a supercell
Without being blown clear across the country
By the wind https://t.co/yio6mxQxSL

author: Jen Walton
text:
A bit of cauliflower & inflow from a supercell on Friday’s dust bowl chase near Winona, KS. Tbh I’m just happy you can see anything at all, lol. 🥴

#stormhour #kswx #girlswhochase https://t.co/vlqIud965c

author: Jen Walton
text: This.. 🙃🙃🙃🙃 https://t.co/jd6VSeewdw

author: Jen Walton
text:
Today is my 7th Diaversary - the “anniversary” of when I was diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes. We celebrate bc it means we successfully tackled this autoimmune disorder for 1 more year. 💙

I celebrated by doing what I love- chasing!! ⛈ w ⁦@TaraWhichello⁩ https://t.co/ah61QrzFJu

author: Jen Walton
text: View of storm passing over Oakley, facing east from Winona, 7:50pm. Contrast a little tough to come by. ⁦@NWSGoodland⁩ #kswx https://t.co/gSbZNpzcuX

text: View of the storm just passed over Monument, facing east from McAllaster. 7:20pm. ⁦@NWSGoodland⁩ #kswx https://t.co/Zx4UXpUMGB

author: Jen Walton
text: Today may be a rough one for Colorado; please everyone be careful & safe out there. https://t.co/7t3c8mI0yd

author: Jen Walton
text:
It was literally one year ago TODAY this piece by @CReppWx aired in Denver. It was huge for me then, & still is now. 

Today, I was on NBC’s national coverage with a amazing group of women I so greatly respect, admire & look up to. 

Don’t wait. Chase your dreams. 🌪 https://t.co/mtO3tyTBCn
